column2: 1. Sourcing Procurement    : Lead the sourcing mandate for the designated projects. column2: The Lead Engineer, based in India, will primarily be responsible for all sourcing related activities from India suppliers including identification of potential suppliers, RFQ process with suppliers, NDA sign off and management, RFQ pack preparation, first assessment visit, purchasing agreement sign off, commercial negotiations etc. This role will report into the global sourcing team in India and will be closely working with the category teams, purchasing teams at plant, engineering and project team for project bids, supplier quality organization in India.                      Principle Duties and Responsibilities (But not limited to)                        Management and execution of RFQ process, RFQ tracker management.                          Responsible to get a fast and close to accurate quote within the project bid dates.                          Ability to work and collate RFQ packs including drawings, technical specification in case of need.                          Identification of potential suppliers aligned with company strategy.                          NDA and Master Purchase agreement management and sign off with supplier, working in alignment and agreement with legal team for any changes.                          First assessment visits to suppliers.                          Price agreements, commercial negotiations with suppliers.                          Management of Celeros paid tooling at suppliers.                          Supplier risk assessment and reporting.                          Kick of meeting on new projects and hand over to assigned supplier quality engineer.                          Commercial management of all India spent with suppliers.                          Work with a continuous improvement mind set and promote continuous improvement at suppliers.                          Report and stop work for any HSE non compliances to Celeros or regulatory requirements.                          Any other assigned responsibilities from time to time.                          Target to meet company minimum margins on project bids and to supplier contract management during the execution phase.                          Support suppliers for any payment issues.                          First line of relationship building at supplier.                          Secure capacity at supplier for Celeros parts and report any risk.                          Monthly reporting of order booking and RFQ lost or opportunities lost.                        Knowledge, Skills and Abilities                        Knowledge of global raw material prices and trends and impact on contracts with suppliers                          Knowledge of pumps and valves as a product.                          Knowledge on logistics management would be a plus.                          Knowledge on pump and valve components manufacturing process (minimum Casting, forging process, digital manufacturing experience would be a plus).                          Strong negotiation skills.                          Strong understanding of commercial terms including legal requirements in a contract                          Strong business communication skills in English (written, oral and soft).                          Soft skills - computer usage skills - as a minimum, use of Microsoft office apps including ability to create visual PowerPoints / reports for communicating and reporting.                          Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with suppliers and Celeros leadership team.                          Ability to work on own and within a team environment.                          Ability to read and interpret drawings and technical specifications in a must.                          Ability to work and understand 3D models is an advantage.                          Ability to converse in Hindi is preferred.                        Education and Experience                        Bachelors degree in engineering is a must, mechanical engineering preferred (any branch of engineering can be considered), full time 4-year course from a university recognized by UGC of India.                      Additional qualifications on finance is a plus.                          10 - 15 years work experience minimum with sourcing background in OEM is needed. Pump OEM based sourcing experience strongly preferred.
column11: Supply chain, Global sourcing, SAP, Contract management, Pumps, Risk assessment, Relationship building, Valves, RFQ, Continuous improvement

column2: Graduate engineer having 12 to 15 years of experience in Oil & Gas industry. The Expeditor will be responsible for timely receipt of purchased equipment, materials & services. He will need to work closely with projects, engineering & procurement teams to meet the project timelines & objectives.         III. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES           Must have the knowledge and practical experience of manufacturing processes for Heat Exchangers, large vessels, tanks, electrical equipment, static & rotating equipment, and structural steel etc      Manage suppliers as well as interface with cross-function teams      In-depth knowledge of materials, manufacturing processes, packing, shipping requirements etc      Ensure the on-time delivery of materials/equipment/services in term of project timing, key milestones and quality control gates.      Able to read & understand life cycle of purchase orders, the drawings requirements, product schedules and shipping documentation.      Very good supplier relationships and proactively work for anticipated delays.     Ensure reporting to project/clients.      Work closely with projects, engineering & procurement teams to meet the project time lines & objectives      Willing to travel as per business on short / long term basis.      Effectively participate in Continuous Improvement activities         IV. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS             bachelors Degree in Mechanical or welding Engineering      Knowledge of materials, equipment, project schedule etc and other applicable manufacturing codes & standards      Excellent English language proficiency is required (oral and written).      Should be able to manage supplier s claims.     Experience      At least 08-12 years of working experience with min. of 08 years in project management or expediting function with multinational company, preferably within the Industrial equipment, Oil and Gas Industries.      Familiar with fabrication equipment design / manufacturing process is preferred.      Knowledge of Quality System, ISO9001, Lean Six Sigma       Skills     - Self-starter and proactive   - Good business communication and interpersonal skills   - Excellent problem solving skills   - Team player   - High ethical conduct   - Familiar with procurement and supplier chain management processes   - Project management skills   - Professional proficiency in Word, Excel and PowerPoint

column2: Manage the overall development of key supply chain short- and long-term sourcing strategies for the assigned commodity in India, with alignment to global commodity objectives, to gain the optimum result for the Organization. Coordinate deployment of actions in support of the strategic approach working closely with the Manufacturing Engineering and Supplier Quality Engineering resources. Responsibilities include improving supplier delivery, lead-time, Cost, and total cost of ownership.       Develop and implement supply chain strategies to meet manufacturing needs and business objectives.         Maintain an in-depth knowledge of global industry activity through close working relationships with suppliers, trade organizations, and market trends.      RFQ and Price finalization as per commodity/Supplier strategy for the assigned commodity     Identify, coordinate, and track implementation of e-sourcing events.     Conducting supplier Business reviews / monthly performance reviews.         Manage projects through completion by coordinating technical and commercial reviews with suppliers, Quality Assurance, Engineering and Procurement associates as needed across the business.     Meet or exceed desired service levels and inventory targets as defined for the products assigned, validated through procurement metrics by maintaining right purchasing parameter integrity in Sites business systems (Oracle).     Implement core procurement processes efficiently and accurately for assigned products by follow-up from Timely PO release, follow up for order confirmation, for actual status of material for open orders and ensure to dispatch on time and co-ordination for on time payment to suppliers.       2. Identify and implement cost containment/reduction opportunities.     Alternate sourcing, design improvements, part standardization, supplier consolidation, Lead Time Agreement, etc.,     3. Manage supplier performance:     Track and monitor supplier performance metrics of On Time Delivery, analyze and derive action plans for eliminating the root causes of any delays, which affects the delivery performance, process improvements to reduce lead time etc.,     4. Develop and benchmark standard processes among suppliers.           Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:           Able to read engineering drawings, understand Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T), quality systems requirements and customer specifications.     Carry out duties with minimum supervision.     Ability to evaluate quotes / pricing.     Able to manage and schedule multiple priorities and meet timelines.     Possess strong analytical and negotiation skills and ability to work with internal partners & external suppliers.     Working knowledge on MRP (Oracle) and MS Office tools Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint      Strong presentation skills and better understanding of the process     Travel - 25%     English required; Multilingual preferred           Education / Experience Required:           Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience in engineering (Mechanical, Metallurgical, Instrumentation, Electrical & Electronics) required. Expertise in Casting, Forging (closed die / Open Die), machining, Bar parts and experience in rubber, Fasteners, plastic, springs, stampings are a plus.     4 to 6 years experience in supplier improvement efforts with demonstrated analytical and communication skills; operations and/or procurement experience preferred.       ?

As a successful family-owned company on a path to global growth, the Brose Group offers challenging responsibilities and exciting career opportunities to performance-driven, skilled specialists with solid professional knowledge and proven career expertise who wish to contribute to our company s success.Your tasks        Supports the management of the whole supply chain from material planning, inward through internal logistics until deliveries to customer through good planning activities, well-balanced stock control, and reliable physical flow management.     Create and maintain an SAP based system to manage and execute material receiving & warehouse processes.     Independent conception, budgeting, planning, realization, and documentation of competitive logistics concepts for new projects.     Preparing budgeting and describing competitive logistics concepts including determining logistics costs based on the defined processes.     Work closely with the project teams so as to support all material flow design and related activities for new program implementations.     Run cost saving ideas and implement the same in timely manner.     Support for Purchasing in the allocation process for production material at landed cost taking the logistics.     Objectives (supply reliability, minimum stocks, minimum logistics costs) into account.     Maintain the logistics data of series running projects (Logistics Data Sheet, Packaging Data Sheet, Logistics BOM, Packaging Working instruction, Logistics Agreement).     Planning of Logistics equipment, layouts and material flow in the plant, planning and further optimizing of the entire supply chain.     Supplier management co - ordinating with all suppliers following the complete purchase cycle from material planning to final payment to the suppliers as per agreed payment terms.     Keep close watch on the LO costs & define actions for the optimization / reduction by new ideas, concepts.     Support the complete supply chain contributing on time inward, line feeding & dispatch to customers with complete internal control & system adherence.     Design, standardize and follow the logistics planning processes and releases to pertinent parties.     Experience in automotive environment a plus.     Experience in customer project management a plus.     Advanced knowledge of SAP, MS Office with excellent knowledge of EXCEL.     Familiar with transportation and packaging concepts.     Fluency in English.           Your Profile        B.E. Mechanical / Production / Automobile / Equivalent.     10-12 years.     Project Management skills and good team player.     Material flow design Strong Logistics concept understanding.     Advance Excel and PowerPoint.     Strong ERP understanding SAP.     Ability to perform under pressure situations.     Time management, priority setting and people management.     Strong communication skills & multitasking ability.
